results.abstract: The complex realities of subsistence escape “Hillbilly Elegy.” But as far back as Charlie Chaplin’s “City Lights,” filmmakers have been turning a discerning eye on destitution.

results.abstract: These days everybody wants a piece of the nonfiction game. HBO’s documentary heads, Nancy Abraham and Lisa Heller, talked about how they’re navigating the evolving landscape.
results.title: HBO Documentary Has Competition. These Women Don’t Seem Worried.

results.title: Dave Prowse, Man Behind Darth Vader’s Mask, Is Dead at 85
results.abstract: Mr. Prowse went from being a weight lifting champion in Britain to helping portray one of the most memorable villains in movie history. But his voice did not make the edit.

results.abstract: Best known in the United States for his role in the 2001 film “Amélie,” he was a staple of the Comédie-Française theater company and a familiar supporting actor in dozens of movies.
results.title: Michel Robin, Longtime French Character Actor, Dies at 90

results.abstract: Thousands of TikTok users, including musical theater professionals, are creating a Broadway-style adaptation of the animated Disney film about a rat with culinary aspirations.
